corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: It is not uncommon for people when telling stories about themselves to stress how frightened they were by some experience .
Presently there were feet on the stairs -- a headlong clatter that would have frightened her had she been capable of ordinary feelings .
Hugh breathed heavily like a man who was dreaming and opened his eyes with a start as though his dream had frightened him awake .
On one of his recent trips they had frightened him so much that he dropped his food and had to watch helplessly while they devoured every last scrap of it .
` It frightened me that you had not told me .
If there were to be nightmares , she could not control that ; but she would not waste her waking time frightening herself with a terror which was past .
It frightens me how a child can be made of flesh and blood but decay to wood .
Now , it frightens me what could lie in store for this Rangers team . "
I do n't know who frightened who more .
It seemed there was nothing he could do to persuade the child to cease her disobedience , nothing he could say which would frighten her sufficiently for her to come to her senses .
You had to frighten kids to make them behave , but there was no need to scare them too much .
It frightened me to think that my name and address and those of the other members were on police files for no other reason than that we were gay .
IT FRIGHTENED me to see just how addicted our youngsters have become to computer games after reading of the 15,000-strong crowd at the Future Entertainment Show at Earls Court .
It frightens me to think that not only are we so vulnerable to these monsters but also that we are constantly blamed for being provocative or careless .
She was already determined that nothing should ever frighten her .
His quietness frightened her .
The knife frightened her , and she was relieved when he threw it down .
Harriet thought that Ben was trying to frighten Paul , but Paul was hysterical .
Because people are so angry , they 're frustrated with the system and their anger gets in the way and it frightens people .
He said he 'd only meant to frighten the victim , not kill him .
What frightens you most about London ?
He would inevitably be frightened by the experience , because he would know that he can not yet expect to walk safely .
Yet not before he had been thoroughly frightened by the ghosts who warned him of terrible judgment .
One was frightened by a bee escaping from a hive
Ever since childhood , while talking to the very old , she had been frightened by visions of herself attacking , hitting , assaulting , knocking off their glasses .
I was so frightened by the blind man 's violence that I obeyed him without question , and took him into the room where the sick captain was sitting .
She was frightened by his earnestness .
But most of us are frightened by our emotions so we like to pretend that rationality Is normal .
He wanted to ask her so many things , but was wary of frightening her any more than he had already .
Stephanie , double , self-contained , so egg-inviolate that Charlie did not frighten her nor Mary shake her calm assurance .
It was the feeling she had had as a child when she frightened herself with a detective story .
Just told the older kids to stop frightening the younger ones . "
` But you 're also weak and you frighten easily .
Graeme Souness , an Edinburgh man who does n't frighten easily , once recalled how the scariest moment of his life unfolded outside Parkhead when he made the acquaintance of two locals .
I 'm not frightened by this , but I am faintly guilty about not feeling guilty .
But the performer was a bit frightened by the three-month-long 48-city tour he is undertaking with Lorna .
CBW can have a greater psychological impact than conventional explosives , as suggested by the 2001 anthrax letter attacks , which killed only five people but frightened millions of Americans .
With the death of Garcia , the pursuit might cease , since such a death might frighten others from the task .
